>U.C 0079: The Principality of Zeon declares a war of independence against the Earth's Federated government, leading into a conflict historical known as "The spacenoid independence war". Of the countless vessels that had participated in this vicious conflict, a battle carrier by the designation "White Base" would earn it's place in history, with its Captain Bright Noa commanding it.

>U.C 0087/88: Hostilities between the Earth's Federated government and the anti-government insurgent movement known as "Alliance against Earth" breaks out into a full-scale war, coming to be known as "The second spacenoid independence war". During this period of time, the Federation capitol of Dakar is nearly sacked, only being protected due to the actions of Bright Noa,the Federation would carve out a victory in this brutal period. Shortly following this victory, a period of chaos in the Federations government would take place with the revealing of the "Deeproots", a collective of political and industrial elites vying to use the conflict for their own gains. Leading a purge of this element, B**gh* N** would move to centralize his control over the Federations government and to push for the defeat of the Alliance agianst Earth. Shortly following this centralization of power however, [***** ***] would call for the total assimilation of the anti-Zeon task force, Titans. Utilizing these newly gained resources, the Alliance against Earth would be defeated with the combined efforts of the Federation, and the return of the long missing hero of the Federation, NT-1, or "Amuro Ray". As originally promised, [Bright] would begin rapidly pushing for reforms to the Earth's sphere...

>Five years have passed...

>U.C 0093: Born from the looming shadow of the regime of [Bright], a woman claiming to be the true successor to Zeon, a man desperate to return order to a world in chaos, and the father of the greatest soldier in the Federations history, make their moves...

As a show Delta doesn't seem to have been particularly successful, no. If you take a look at SomeAniThing's home media database for instance: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1A33miTSU1NHdVO7F8kMT68wgkM6uW8YThKPEsDvLKsc/edit#gid=427506025

Sales Average
> Macross F: 46,297
> Macross Delta: 12,769

Which won't tell the whole story on it's own, but even the movie doesn't appear to have done well comparable to Frontier. The two Macross Frontier movies together made roughly ¥1, 350,000,000, but only the second Delta movie even appears to be listed and that's with a much lower take than either Frontier movie at ¥177,434,360. It does say the two Delta movies sold 75k tickets total, but that's in comparison to the roughly 500k tickets the Frontier movies sold.

Delta doesn't exactly shine when you look at the NHK poll from 2019 (https://www.nhk.or.jp/anime/macross/ranking/) either. It's the lowest placed of the Macross TV animations at 6th, and while the second movie wasn't out yet at the time, the first only placed 9th. The higest placed Delta character was Kaname at 5th, Freyja at 8th, Mikumo at 14th, Messer at 18th etc. Both the TV and movie versions of Sheryl alone beat out any Delta character when looking at individual rankings. The highest placed Delta mech was Messer's VF-31F at 8th, and the only other one even in the top 25 is Keith's SV-262 at 15th. There's several more in the top 50, but Delta's not beloved mechanically either in general is me point.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>21309224
Extremely fun to use, especially if you like Layzner/SPT-type mecha.
In terms of locomotion there's no comparison, you can cover way more ground, more quickly in vehicle mode, and vertically jump higher to reach stuff you couldn't on foot; vehicle mode also makes running away from stronger enemies easier, so you're way less likely to die in the field.
In terms of combat the difference is night and day.
On foot fighting is like an uphill struggle for any inch of ground you can gain, you're incredibly weak and face hugely lopsided odds.
In mech you can actually 1v3 stronger opponents with the right equipment, you get to rattle off the different moves at a fair clip, waste smaller enemies in seconds and actually kill big ones without taking fifteen minutes or getting a total party kill right before the end of the fight. The "trans-am" mode works way better than the on-foot equivalent, too.
For me the robot gameplay definitely brought back those initial feelings of "woah this is a cool game."

***READ THE GUIDE***

THE GUIDE: http://gunpla.buyfags.moe/

***READ THE GUIDE***

For those new to gunpla/plamo or even just new to this thread; please read the guide. Please read it before asking questions, as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model". If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here!
If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!

And remember to report any shitposting and spam to keep the thread clean and civil.

>Why won't anyone answer my question?
Try being specific, especially about your materials and process. Post images whenever possible; even if the kit/part looks bad, you are more likely to get help posting images.

>Why are my pictures sideways?
4chan strips EXIF data from images when they're uploaded to the site from your phone, including the orientation display tag. To fix this, save your images separately, or use an app that will rotate and save the images for you.
One commonly used app that works well on Android:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.simplemobilephotoresizer

***READ THE GUIDE***

THE GUIDE: http://gunpla.buyfags.moe/

***READ THE GUIDE***

For those new to gunpla/plamo or even just new to this thread; please read the guide. Please read it before asking questions, as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model". If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here!
If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!

And remember to report any shitposting and spam to keep the thread clean and civil.

>Why won't anyone answer my question?
Try being specific, especially about your materials and process. Post images whenever possible; even if the kit/part looks bad, you are more likely to get help posting images.

>Why are my pictures sideways?
4chan strips EXIF data from images when they're uploaded to the site from your phone, including the orientation display tag. To fix this, save your images separately, or use an app that will rotate and save the images for you.
One commonly used app that works well on Android:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.simplemobilephotoresizer

>copypasta

The Mulian world MU and Earth are parallel worlds overlapping that will eventually destroy each other. This is a natural phenomenon.

Renegade Mulian scientist Barbem made the Xephon System which consists of two robots, Rahxephon and Belxephon. The system can rewrite the clashing worlds into one, saving it from destruction, and activates through a ritual in which the two robots fight, and the winner's Orin (pilot) decides what the resulting world will be like subconsciously. This is the tuning.

Ayato is Rahxephon's Orin, while Kuon (his biological mother) is Belxephon's. The stuff about them and Itsuki should be clear enough from the show.

Yolotheotl is the state of the Orin becoming worthy of the Xephon and enabling it to participate in the ritual. The Ishtori are manifestations of the Xephons' will (never seen in the show, but Belxephon/Kuon's Ishtori takes on Ayato's form).

The two factions, Earth and MU, think that the tuning results in one world surviving and the other being destroyed. The whole show is basically people trying to influence Ayato and Kuon so that the tuning will benefit them more. Ayato was kidnapped because if left the way he was at the beginning of the series, his winning would have had him create a world completely beneficial to the Mulians, and since he was unaware of the outside world, it might have erased everything except Mu entirely.

Barbem, being a mad scientist, wasn't trying to save the world(s), he just wanted to see his creations remake everything, and did not tell anyone that the worlds can actually be combined into one.

Also people claiming Rahxephon can rewrite reality are retards who didn't watch the show, it can only do so only when fulfilling the conditions which took Barbem thousands of years to get right, and even then nobody really has any control over any of it; It creates an ideal world according to the Orin's subconscious.

>>21312506
Kuon and Maya are the twin Mulians that were found and taken in by Rikudou. Ayato and Itsuki are Kuon’s biological twin sons (genetically engineered, biological father is Watari). Maya ran away with Ayato resulting in the age gap with Itsuki due to Tokyo Jupiter’s time shit. Also Watari was married to Maya and they were raising Ayato as their son together before the war but Maya erased those memories when she took him with her.

The Ishtori takes on the form of the person most precious to the Orin. For Kuon it's her son Ayato. For Ayato it's his first love Haruka, but his memories of her were also erased by Maya.

In layman’s terms

Orin = pilot
Ishtori = Basically the robot’s AI
Yolotheotl = Getting good

So “Reika” hounding Ayato calling him orin and telling him to reach yolotheotl is the Rahxephon itself saying “hey pilot get your shit together” to him

The problem is that they never outright spell out what each made-up word means so people get confused. Instead it’s stuff like “Orin you must become yolotheotl so that your orin will also yolotheotl and as orin in yolotheotl you will be one with ishtori to begin the tuning”

When Reika refers to orin while speaking to ayato but not saying it AT him directly it actually means “the other orin” = Kuon

>>21295645
>There were Star Wars EU novels and comics telling their own story for years before "The Empire Strikes Back" was released, so how were they bridging a gap?
The three Han Solo Adventures pulps by Brian Daley and a Novel, plus the marvel comics and eventually Newspaper strips.

Then the Three Lando pulps by L Neil Smith and the Radioplays (Adapted by Daley) of ANH and ESB shortly after ESB with marvel and the newspaper strips still running, and Daley's comic of Ord Mantell, so there's at least two and I think now 3-5 "That Bounty Hunter on Ord Mantell" stories.

Daley eventually did the final RotJ Raidoplay (Sadly without Mark Hamill or Billy Dee Williams{They didn't even get a black guy or someone trying to sound black, White as fuck Lando is funny to listen to), but Anthony Daniels were there for all three) It also came out in like 96 so it had tie ins to the broader EU that blossomed with the WEG games and Heir to the Empire in '92.

Mara's disguised identity shows up at the palace and Han mentions hearing that Lando almost got the Falcon destroyed at Coruscant (Shadows of the Empire) Honestly the Newspaper strips I think l may have come after ESB, but interestingly enough they actually had some accidental "Settup" for ESB in some of the earliest full issue marvel comics.

The falcon has to extend an air pressure and radiation/temperature protection shield to "Touch shields" with another ship so Han and a pirate can make a handoff with just jetpacks and air masks. Which explains the Mynock scene only needing breathmasks in ESB.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
All that aside, the cockpit isn't glass. It's transparent, but that doesn't make it glass because glass is not the only transparent material in existence and transparent does not automatically equate to "weak" either. More than that, other, real military equipment like planes use transparent cockpits without it being a major weakness too, because the units are usually going fast enough or high enough that pin point fire isn't a major concern, and if your unit can be hit with such precision you're probably doing something wrong anyway. Mostly though, the cockpit placement was a personal request by Tomino and not Mead's decision.

https://tsukinomayu.com/2022/07/17/the-history-and-production-of-turn-a-gundam-part-iii-prelude/

> Tomino requested that the design be “sleek” and “graceful”, like a kick-boxer instead of a sumo wrestler, and that the face needed to be more distinct and inside its helmet, like a “persona”. He also requested the cockpit to be in the “womb position”, not unlike the Brains from Brain Powerd, and while Mead found this “uterus”-focus to be odd he didn’t question the mindset.

>>21305369

Tomino talks in his Turn A no Iyashiki book about how during the show's production the producers assured him that he didn't need to worry that the ratings were low because the management liked what he was doing with Turn A, so they'd ensure it was able to finish regardless of it's reception. So yeah, while Tomino has certainly had his problems with Sunrise producers over the years, he's also still known a lot of them for decades and probably has a lot more leeway with them than he would have with others.

>I feel like I've read accounts from staff of Tomino re-working their contributions so heavily they didn't recognize their own work at all, though I'm also pretty sure it was scripts in his case rather than storyboards.

First thing that came to mind for me regarding this is Gobu Fuyunori's resentment over Tomino "adapting" the script (or script direction) and story to fit his usual sensibilities, which has become known as "Tomino-bushi", on the production of Xabungle. He (Gobu) got fed up and pretty much severed ties with Tomino, at least professionally, and never worked directly with him on another project ever again. They were close collaborators before this, having worked alongside each other on Robot Romance, Reideen and Zambot 3.

I find it funny how Gobu ended up working on Tomino-related stuff though, like 0083, G Gundam and the Dunbine OVA. Makes me wonder if he did those out of spite.

>Tomino is not a big fan of anime full stop, and the only reason he even watches his own work is because he has to do so as part of his job.

He watched through Turn A three times on his own leisure (according to Turn A no Iyashi). Then again, it holds sentimental value to him beyond just being business-as-usual, so it might be an exception. He also watched the Kimetsu movie and apparently gained some inspiration from it or something.

threads.com:
***READ THE GUIDE***

THE GUIDE: http://gunpla.buyfags.moe/

***READ THE GUIDE***

For those new to gunpla/plamo or even just new to this thread; please read the guide. Please read it before asking questions, as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model". If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here!
If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!

And remember to report any shitposting and spam to keep the thread clean and civil.

>Why won't anyone answer my question?
Try being specific, especially about your materials and process. Post images whenever possible; even if the kit/part looks bad, you are more likely to get help posting images.

>Why are my pictures sideways?
4chan strips EXIF data from images when they're uploaded to the site from your phone, including the orientation display tag. To fix this, save your images separately, or use an app that will rotate and save the images for you.
One commonly used app that works well on Android:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.simplemobilephotoresizer
